subject: RE: [junit]Junit and classpath
msgSnippet: ... c: myjdk bin java -classpath .;c: junit32 junit.jar junit.swingui.TestRunner pause ... which I can put in any project s root directory, and allows me to
messageBody:
I make a batch file containing:
---
c:\myjdk\bin\java -classpath .;c:\junit32\junit.jar junit.swingui.TestRunner
pause
---
which I can put in any project's root directory, and allows me to change
classpath, JUnit version and JDK version by changing this file. You don't
have to set environment variables etc...
You dont have to unzip the jar or src.zip.

-----Original Message-----
From: Yue Wu [mailto:wybox@...]
Sent: vrijdag 29 juni 2001 15:17
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] (unknown)


Hi,
I load junit to my PC in NT, and jdk1.2.2. Unzip
junit32.zip(change junit3.2 root directory to junit32,
because it's confused with java path). Add junit.jar
to the classpath. When I run " java
junit32.junit.ui.TestRunner
junit32.junit.samples.AllTests" command, got this
message:

Exception in thread "main"
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
junit32/junit/ui/TestRunner

How come it is? I unziped src.zip to the root
directory (junit32 here) and compile TestRunner.java
to class file. What's wrong here? I'll be appreciated
if someone can point out to me.

Oliver
